title: Mba 3024
message: Had a 3024 come through. History of liquid damage near DCIN Connector. Also shorted U7720. Board was "dead" though running... No fan. Restored P1V8_S0 Got fan to spin, and computer to start up. Only problem now is that the light on the charger stays green despite a dead battery, and still shows possible charging. When I disconnect the charger, the screen goes dark, but the fan keeps spinning... anyone have any suggestions?

title: Mba 3024
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22397"]Bad IO board/cable.[/QUOTE]

[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] forgot to mention that I already put in a known good one... is there a designated display circuit for DCIN? Thanks for your help

title: Mba 3024
message: Must be an issue with SMC_LID, so could also be the trackpad cable/connectors.
